forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 20 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a curtain of rain graces the city, with the low-hanging clouds wrapping everything in a soft gray embrace. The air carries a chill, promising temperatures that linger in the mid-fifties. Wind dances through the streets, a lively companion at 20 to 23 mph, occasionally gusting stronger—whispers of the storm that is firmly upon us. A 60% chance of precipitation means the city will wear its wet attire throughout the day, with new rain gathering in its folds.

By midday, the rain won’t relent, nor will the heavy clouds. As the high teeters near 62, the temperatures will slowly wane, folding into a cozy 60 in the afternoon. Those embarking outside should don layers, favoring water-resistant jackets and sturdy footwear to navigate puddles and slick sidewalks. It’s a good day for intimate cafés inviting you in with the warm glow of their lights, the soft clinking of cups shared over whispered conversations. Alternatively, meandering through the art-splashed streets or into cozy bookstores could offer refuge from the capricious weather. While the fog may not roll in thick today, the marine layer looms nearby, lending a mystical hush to the backdrop of the city. Embrace the rain; it's well-suited for a comforting, reflective stroll through San Francisco's vibrant soul.
